column4: i installed a generic driver for my webcam called spca5xx but when i start camorama to test my webcam it says "could not connect to video device (/dev/video0). Please check connection. someone could help me?
Authentication Rejected, reason : None of the authentication protocols specified are supported and host-based authentication failed.
does it launch though, I know gksudo gedit gives that same warning but always launches
yeah but it says could not connect with video device (/dev/video0)
that sounds like it might be an error with the program, not gksudo
ok thanks i will try with another driver
it says kind of filesystem unrecognized
well your cd is messed up then
get a cd that isn't screwed up
i could install dapper with that cd on yesterday
perhaps it corrupted, but I can tell you that iso9660 is the cd filesystem
i know the problem is the kernel now
